content: hey guys that DM Scottie here and welcome to the craft today I'm gonna do
something a little different you know most of my crafts are about medieval
type settings this one I'm actually doing a zombie apocalypse game I
stumbled on some rules called fear and faith which are some great skirmish
rules and I wanted to do some scenarios with survivors and gangers and that kind
of thing in zombies so I was looking to expanse of my terrain into more modern
territory and I wanted some cars to jump up the battlefield as far as like you
know cover and train and that kind of thing and I wasn't having too much luck
finding stuff I liked but I didn't find these cars called big time let me show
you here it shows on the back here a bunch of different vehicles they have
now these vehicles are 1/32 scale so they're they're a little big for the 28
millimeter 28 30 millimeter but I find that they're pretty close and they're
really not too distracting from the scale itself so I want to go to the
table and show you this car that I mutilating to make it look like a car
that that wrecked and that is gonna be good for cover in the skirmish game so
let's go to the table and we'll talk about it oh and one last thing I also
want to mention that they are fairly cheap these are diecast cars and the
cars I think it was it was less than six dollars the cars that I got I got about
six of them and when they were less than six dollars each so that's a pretty good
value for this type of thing so I just wanted to mention that for
hey guys I wanted to show you this I'm working on a zombie skirmish table and I
wanted to have some vehicles of strewn around and I found these big-time custom

so this used to be a bug but as you can see I mess it up pretty good
I hit it with a hammer repeatedly and smashed in the hood that also knocked

port driver went flying so now what I want to do is I want to kind of add a
little more damage to this what and what I can do is I can use my hot glue gun
the small blue the small glue gun and I can you can kind of simulate that by
squirting on there and then kind of pulling
so this will look like a bit more like mangled metal

at all also the wheel is partially coming off

when I have a comment back I'd get my little wispies off there
all right so that should be pretty good it's pretty secure there so we got a

the finished car and I've got some survivors next to it and the scale is a
little big but it's really not too big let me show you some detail on that so
we've got the hood there and that's the hot glue I painted it with some gunmetal
and then some black to kind of accentuate the damage can you also see I
have some blood coming down the windshield which I thought was a nice
touch and so yeah I think that really came out nice I didn't mention too that
when I smashed this up before I put it together I hit with a little black spray
paint too to give it some age and damage so there we go that's our our cheap car
we can use for cover in our zombie games and I'll see you next time on the craft
